result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle J Wilcox was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Kyle J Wilcox in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton by phone.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was due to start jail sentence on 6/1/15, jail would not except him due to JOC not being completed.  JOC was not completed Waiver of preliminary hearing was not discussed at the time of the plea.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing was filed.  Court accepted Waiver, found probable cause, bound defendant over.  The plea/sentencing was held on 5/11/15.  Jail credit 1 day due for reporting on 6/1/15.  Defendant will now report on 6/2/15 at 7 pm.

Atty. Lawton stated he went over the preliminary waiver with the defendant and he believes defendant understood. Lawton requests any further discussion be done on the record in the event of the DPA being revoked.

DPA   Filed by District Attorney Jane Kohlwey

Defendant Kyle J Wilcox in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant plead no contest to Cts. 1,2, & 3.  On count 1 court withheld adjudication, and approved DPA for 24 months.  Cts. 2 & 3 Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Cts. 4,5,6, & 7 are dismissed but read in.  Victim made statement.  Requested contact with defendant.  Cts. 2 & 3 court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 2 years.  Conditions of probation include:  $453.00 costs each.  50 hours of community service.  Maintain full time employment or school or both.  Restitution in the probation amount of $2068.90 with a total of $2275.79.  No contact with Dairy Queen in Portage, WI.  10 days jail with Huber on Ct. 2.  AODA and comply.  9 days jail credit not able to be used towards conditional jail time. Jail start on 6/1/15 at 7:00 pm.  Court modified bond to allow incidental contact with L.R. at family events.
